Class PiecewiseFunction

java.lang.Object
PiecewiseFunction
public class PiecewiseFunction extends Object

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PiecewiseFunction()
    Create a PiecewiseFunction object Initializes arrays of x and y values by computing the function values over the specified interval

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    int
    calculateSteps(double start, double end, double step)
    Calculates the number of steps between start and end
    double
    computeY(double x)
    Computes the value of the function for a given x if x < 1.4: y = a * x^2 + b * x + c if x == 1.4: y = a / x + sqrt(x^2 + 1) if x > 1.4: y = (a + b * x) / sqrt(x^2 + 1)
    int
    getIndexOfMaxY()
    Finds the index of the max y in the array

    Finds the index of the min y in the array

    Returns the x at the specific index
    double

    Returns the y at the specific index
    static void
    main(String[] args)
    Entry point of the program Creates a PiecewiseFunction object Prints max and min el-s with their idc

  • Constructor Details

    • PiecewiseFunction

      public PiecewiseFunction()
      Create a PiecewiseFunction object Initializes arrays of x and y values by computing the function values over the specified interval

  • Method Details

    • calculateSteps

      public int calculateSteps(double start, double end, double step)
      Calculates the number of steps between start and end
      Parameters:
      start - the beginning of the interval
      end - the end of the interval
      step - the step size
      Returns:
      the number of points in the interval

    • computeY

      public double computeY(double x)
      Computes the value of the function for a given x
      • if x < 1.4: y = a * x^2 + b * x + c
      • if x == 1.4: y = a / x + sqrt(x^2 + 1)
      • if x > 1.4: y = (a + b * x) / sqrt(x^2 + 1)
      Parameters:
      x - the input arg
      Returns:
      the computed func value

    • getX

      public double getX(int index)
      Returns the x at the specific index
      Parameters:
      index - in the xValues array
      Returns:
      y-value

    • getY

      public double getY(int index)
      Returns the y at the specific index
      Parameters:
      index - in the yValues array
      Returns:
      x-value

    • getIndexOfMaxY

      public int getIndexOfMaxY()
      Finds the index of the max y in the array
      Returns:
      the index of the max el

    • getIndexOfMinY

      public int getIndexOfMinY()
      Finds the index of the min y in the array
      Returns:
      the index of the min el

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Entry point of the program Creates a PiecewiseFunction object Prints max and min el-s with their idc
      Parameters:
      args - command-line arguments (not used)
